perturbation.original_text:
3    PAYMENTS  AND  REPORTS  TO  LICENSOR
     3.1  Reporting:  Quarterly;  30  days  after  end  of  quarter
     3.2  Payment  terms:  30  days  after  receipt  of  invoice
perturbation.changed_text:
3    PAYMENTS  AND  REPORTS  TO  LICENSOR
     3.1  Reporting:  Quarterly;  30  days  after  end  of  quarter
     3.2  Payment  terms:  60 days  after  receipt  of  invoice
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by extending the payment terms to 60 days after receipt of the invoice in Appendix 2, while the rest of the contract is silent regarding the payment deadline, thus creating potential for dispute over which deadline is valid.

perturbation.original_text:
7.1  Unless  otherwise  stated  in  the  Appendix  the  term of this letter
          Agreement  shall  continue  for  twenty-four  (24)  months  with  the
          effective  date  unless  terminated sooner or extended pursuant to the
          terms hereof ("Initial Term"). The Initial Term shall automatically be
          extended  for  an additional period of half a year unless either party
          provides  the  other party with written notification of termination of
          the  letter  Agreement  at  least 60 days prior to end of such period.
perturbation.changed_text:
7.1  Unless  otherwise  stated  in  the  Appendix  the  term of this letter
          Agreement  shall  continue  for  twenty-four  (24)  months  with  the
          effective  date  unless  terminated sooner or extended pursuant to the
          terms hereof ("Initial Term"). The Initial Term shall automatically be
          extended  for  an additional period of one year unless either party
          provides  the  other party with written notification of termination of
          the  letter  Agreement  at  least 90 days prior to end of such period.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates an in-text contradiction by modifying the automatic extension period of the agreement from half a year to one year and changing the notification period for termination from 60 to 90 days in section 7.1. This conflicts with other possible sections of the agreement (implied or explicit) that depend on the original value of the extension and notification periods, creating ambiguity and potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
7.5  After termination  of  this  contract,  there  shall  be  a  sell-off
          period  (defined  in  APPENDIX 2) following the date of termination of
          this  contract.
perturbation.changed_text:
7.5  After termination  of  this  contract,  there  shall  be  a  sell-off
          period  (defined  in  APPENDIX 2) following the date of termination of
          this  contract.
     7.6  There is no sell-off period after the termination of this contract.
perturbation.explanation: This perturbation introduces a direct contradiction by stating that there *is* a sell-off period in section 7.5 and then stating there is *no* sell-off period in section 7.6. This directly contradicts the previous clause and creates uncertainty about post-termination rights.
